member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.TreeViewItem.IsSelectionActive
member.summary: Whether this or any contained TreeViewItems are selected.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.TreeViewItem.IsSelected
member.summary: Whether this is selected.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.TreeViewItem.IsExpanded
member.summary: Whether the TreeViewItem is displaying its expanded content (sub items)

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.Games.DialogBox.LettersPerSecond
member.summary: The number of letters to show per second when printing out in "typewriter style". If null, 0, or negative, then the text is shown immediately.

member.name: E:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.Games.DialogBox.FinishedShowing
member.summary: Raised when the dialog box finishes showing all pages.

member.name: E:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.Games.DialogBox.FinishedTypingPage
member.summary: Raised whenever a page finishes typing out, either automatically or in response to input.

member.name: F:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.Games.DialogBox.AdvancePageInputPredicate
member.summary: If not null, this predicate is used to determine if input has been pressed to advance the input. If null, the default page-advancing logic will be performed.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.Games.DialogBox.Show(System.String,FlatRedBall.Graphics.Layer)
member.summary: Shows the dialog box (adds it to managers and sets IsVisible to true) and begins showing the text.
member.param: The text to print out, either immediately or letter-by-letter according to LettersPerSecond.

The FlatRedBall Layer to add the DialogBox to. If null, the dialog box will not be layered. This will attempt to use a Gum layer matching the FRB layer. This will automatically work if the Layer has been added through the FlatRedBall Editor.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.Games.DialogBox.ShowAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Shows the dialog box (adds it to managers and sets IsVisible to true) and begins showing the text.
member.param: The text to print out, either immediately or letter-by-letter according to LettersPerSecond.
member.returns: A task which completes when the text has been displayed and the DialogBox has been dismissed.

member.name: F:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.Games.DialogBox.showNextPageOnDismissedPage
member.summary: This makes the next page auto-show when pushing input on an already-typed out page. This should be true if doing a normal Show call, but false if in an async call since the async call will internally loop through all pages.

member.name: E:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.Games.InputDeviceSelectionItem.InputDeviceRemoved
member.summary: Event raised when the input device is removed by this item. This can happen through a UI button click.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.Games.InputDeviceSelector.JoinedInputDevices
member.summary: An observable array of joined devices.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.Games.InputDeviceSelector.MaxPlayers
member.summary: Sets the maximum number of players that can join.

member.name: E:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.Games.InputDeviceSelector.ConfirmedJoinedInput
member.summary: Event raised when the user presses the confirm join button, such as the A button on a gamepad or the Enter key on the keyboard. This can be used to advance to the next screen, but the ConfirmJoinedEventArgs should be checked to verify that the game can proceed.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.Games.PlayerJoinView.UnsubscribeFromGamepadEvents
member.summary: Unsubscribes from controller connection events and join/unjoin logic. This is automatically called when the control is removed so it does not need to be called manually unless the control is created but never added/removed from managers.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.Games.PlayerJoinView.SubscribeToGamepadEvents
member.summary: Begins behavior to automatically detect gamepad connect and disconnect events. Also enables join and unjoin logic. This is automatically when the Visual is assigned, which is the default behavior when added through the FlatRedBall Editor.
member.remarks:
For convenience, SubscribeToGamepadEvents is called automatically when the visual is assigned. UnsubscribeFromGamepadEvents must be called, but this happens automatically when the control is removed through the visual's RemoveFromManagers being called. This method does not need to be called directly, but can happen as a result of its parent element being removed. Typically this is the Gum screen which is automatically removed when the FlatRedBall Screen is destroyed.
Note that if the PlayerJoinView is constructed with a visual, but is never added to managers, then it will not unsubscribe from events. While minor, this does accumulate an event on InputManager.ControllerConnectionEvent.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.Games.SettingsView.IsAutoApplyingChangesToEngine
member.summary: Whether changes on the UI are automatically applied to the underlying engine. Set this to false if changes are manually applied (such as through a ViewModel).

member.name: T:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.Popups.ToastManager
member.summary: Object responsible for manging the lifecycle of toasts. This can be used to perform fire-and-forget showing of Toast objects. Internally this creates a Toast object using the FlatRedBall.Forms Toast control.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.Popups.ToastManager.DefaultToastLayer
member.summary: The default layer for showing toast. If this is set at the Screen level, it should be set back to null when the Screen is destroyed.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.Popups.ToastManager.Show(System.String,FlatRedBall.Graphics.Layer,System.Double)
member.summary: Queues a toast to be shown for the given duration. This method can be called from any thread. If a toast is currently shown, then this message is queued and will be shown on the next toast.
member.param: The message to display
The layer for the Toast instance.
The number of seconds to display the toast.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.Popups.ToastManager.DestroyLiveToasts
member.summary: Removes all live toasts from all managers. This is called automatically when a Screen is destroyed.

member.name: E:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.Primitives.ButtonBase.Click
member.summary: Event raised when the user pushes, then releases the control. This means the cursor is over the button, the button was originally pushed, the primary button was pressed last frame, but is no longer pressed this frame. The "click" terminology comes from the Cursor's PrimaryClick property.

member.name: E:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.Primitives.ButtonBase.Push
member.summary: Event raised when the user pushes on the control. This means the cursor is over the button and the primary button was not pressed last frame, but is pressed this frame. The "push" terminology comes from the Cursor's PrimaryPush property.

member.name: E:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.Primitives.ButtonBase.ControllerButtonPushed
member.summary: Event raised when any button is pressed on an Xbox360GamePad which is being used by the GuiManager.GamePadsForUiControl.

member.name: T:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.Primitives.RangeBase
member.summary: Base class for controls which display or allow a user to change a value between a Minimum and Maximum. This is the base class for ScrollBar and Slider.

member.name: F:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.Primitives.RangeBase.cursorGrabOffsetRelativeToThumb
member.summary: Represents the X or Y offset of the cursor relative to the thumb when the thumb was grabbed. If the element is horizontal, this is an X value. If the element is vertical, this is a Y value.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.Primitives.RangeBase.LargeChange
member.summary: The amount to change Value when the user clicks on the track. Only applies if IsMoveToPointEnabled is false.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.Primitives.RangeBase.SmallChange
member.summary: The amount to change Value when the user presses the up or down buttons on a scrollbar, per mouse wheel tick on a scrollbar, and the amount to change the value in response to left/right presses on gamepad or keyboard on a Slider.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.Primitives.RangeBase.Minimum
member.summary: The minimum inclusive value which can be set through the UI.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.Primitives.RangeBase.Maximum
member.summary: The maximum inclusive value which can be set through the UI.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.Primitives.RangeBase.Value
member.summary: The current value of the RangeBase. This value is clamped to be between Minimum and Maximum.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.Primitives.RangeBase.IsMoveToPointEnabled
member.summary: Controls whether clicking on the track sets the value to the clicked position. If true, the value moves to the clicked position. If false, the value increases or decreases according to the LargeChange value.

member.name: E:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.Primitives.RangeBase.ValueChanged
member.summary: Event raised whenever the Value property changes regardless of source. This event may be raised multiple times if the user pushes+drags on the track or thumb.

member.name: E:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.Primitives.RangeBase.ValueChangeCompleted
member.summary: Event raised whenever a Value change has completed. This event is raised for discrete changes such as pressing left/right on a keyboard, or pushes on the track when IsMoveToPointEnabled is set to false.
member.remarks: This event can be used to prevent responding to changes every frame as a user is dragging a thumb or clicking on a track with IsMoveToPointEnabled set to true. Examples of when to use ValueChangeCompleted would be to play an audio cue when changing volume, or committing changes which are too expensive to perform every frame such as saving settings to disk.

member.name: E:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.Primitives.RangeBase.ValueChangedByUi
member.summary: Event raised whenever a Value change is initiated by the UI. This event is not raised when Value changes are performed in code, such as by assigning the Value property.

member.name: E:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.Primitives.RangeBase.OrientationChanged
member.summary: Event raised when the Orientation property is changed.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.Primitives.RangeBase.HandleTrackHover(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Handles the user pushing and holding the mouse button on the track. If IsMoveToPointEnabled is true, this moves the position immediately. Otherwise, it only does so using the track's repeat rate values.
member.remarks: If IsMoveToPointEnabled is set to true, then Value is also updated immediately in HandleTrackDragging;
member.param: The sender of the event.
Args for the event.

member.name: F:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.Button.ButtonCategoryName
member.summary: The name of the Category containing visual states for the Button object.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.Button.Text
member.summary: Text displayed by the button. This property requires that the TextInstance instance be present in the Gum component. If the TextInstance instance is not present, an exception will be thrown in DEBUG mode

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.ComboBox.ListBox
member.summary: Replaces the internal ListBox with the provided instance. This replaces the Items, SelectedObject, and SelectedIndex unless the properties are bound.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.FrameworkElement.IsFocused
member.summary: Whether this element has input focus. If true, the element shows its focused state and receives input from keyboards and gamepads.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.FrameworkElement.ActualHeight
member.summary: The height in pixels. This is a calculated value considering HeightUnits and Height.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.FrameworkElement.ActualWidth
member.summary: The width in pixels. This is a calculated value considering WidthUnits and Width;

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.FrameworkElement.AbsoluteLeft
member.summary: Returns the left of this element in absolute (screen) coordinates

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.FrameworkElement.AbsoluteTop
member.summary: Returns the top of this element in absolute (screen) coordinates

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.FrameworkElement.ActualX
member.summary: The X position of the left side of the element in pixels.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.FrameworkElement.ActualY
member.summary: The Y position of the top of the element in pixels (positive Y is down).

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.FrameworkElement.IsEnabled
member.summary: Whether the element is enabled or not. When disabled, the element does not respond to user input, and displays a disabled state.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.FrameworkElement.DefaultFormsComponents
member.summary: Contains the default association between Forms Controls and Gum Runtime Types. This dictionary enabled forms controls (like TextBox) to automatically create their own visuals. The key in the dictionary is the type of Forms control.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.FrameworkElement.DefaultFormsTemplates
member.summary: Contains the default association from a Forms type (such as Button) to the visual template used for that particular forms type (such as the V2 button style, or a Component loaded from the Gum tool). This may contain standard Gum types such as Gum.Forms.Controls, as well as derived types, such as forms types created from components in generated code.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.FrameworkElement.Show(FlatRedBall.Graphics.Layer)
member.summary: Displays this element visually and adds it to the underlying managers for Cursor interaction.
member.remarks: This is typically only called if the element is instantiated in code. Elements added to a Gum screen in Gum will automatically be displayed when the Screen is created, and calling this will result in the object being added twice.
member.param: The layer to add this to, can be null to add it directly to managers

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.FrameworkElement.ShowDialog(FlatRedBall.Graphics.Layer)
member.summary: Displays this visual element (calls Show), and returns a task which completes once the dialog is removed.
member.param: The FlatRedBall Layer to be used to display the element.
member.returns: A task which will complete once this element is removed from managers.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.FrameworkElement.CallLoaded
member.summary: Calls the loaded event. This should not be called in custom code, but instead is called by Gum

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.FrameworkElement.Activity
member.summary: Every-frame logic. This will automatically be called if this element is added to the FrameworkElementManager

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.FrameworkElement.ReactToVisualRemoved
member.summary: Method raised when the current visual is changed or set to null. If the visual is being replaced, this is called before the new visual is assigned.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.FrameworkElement.GetVisual(System.String)
member.summary: Searches recursively for and returns a GraphicalUiElement (visual) in this instance by name. Returns null if not found.
member.param: The case-sensitive name to search for.
member.returns: The found GraphicalUiElement, or null if no match is found.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.FrameworkElement.IsUsingLeftAndRightGamepadDirectionsForNavigation
member.summary: Whether to use left and right directions as navigation. If false, left and right directions are ignored for navigation.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.FrameworkElement.HandleTab(FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.TabDirection,FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.FrameworkElement,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Shifts focus to the next or previous element in the tab depending on the tabDirection argument.
member.param: The direction to tab
The element which is requesting the tab. This can be a parent of the current element. If null is passed, then this element is treated as the origin of the tab action.
Whether to loop around to the beginning or end if at the last focusable item.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.FrameworkElement.HandleTab(FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.TabDirection,Gum.Wireframe.GraphicalUiElement,Gum.Wireframe.GraphicalUiElement,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.param: The current element that is either focused, or that has been tested for focus and failed. If this is null then the first or last (depending on direction) element is selected.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.FrameworkElement.UpdateState
member.summary: Gets the state according to the element's current properties (such as whether it is enabled) and applies it to refresh the Visual's appearance.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.ItemsControl.Items
member.summary:
The items contained by this ItemsControl. This can contain regular data such as strings, instances of ViewModels, or FrameworkElement instances such as ListBoxItem instances.
Typically the Items is assigned or bound to an ObservableCollection. In this case the ItemsControl automatically creates FrameworkElements (such as ListBoxItem instances) in response to items being added or removed from the Items list.
member.remarks:
The Items list is not guaranteed to reflect the items contained in the ItemsControl if Visual elements have been added directly to the InnerPanel. This can happen if the Visual's InnerPanel's Children are directly added to, or if an instance of an ItemsControl, such as a ListBox, is loaded from the Gum tool pre-filled with ListBoxItems.
If items are not added directly to the InnerPanel, then the Items list and the internal InnerPanel Children will remain in sync since the ItemsControl automatically creates FrameworkElement instances in response to the Items.

member.name: F:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.ScrollIntoViewStyle.BringIntoView
member.summary: Scrolls only if the item is not in view. Scrolls the minimum amount necessary to bring the item into view. In other words, if the item is above the visible area, then the scrolling brings the item to the top. If the item is below the visible area, then the scrolling brings the item to the bottom. If the item is already into view, no scrolling is performed.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.ListBox.CanListItemsLoseFocus
member.summary: Whether pressing the B button (back/cancel) should result in individual items losing focus and returning focus to the top level. This should be false if the list box is the only object in the screen which can receive focus.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.ListBox.LoseListItemFocusOnPrimaryInput
member.summary: Whether the primary input button (usually the A button) results in the highlighted list box item being selected and in the ListBox focus moving outside of the individual items.
member.remarks: This value is true, but can be changed to false if the A button should perform actions on the highlighted list box item (such as toggling a check box) without focus being moved out of the individual items.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.ListBox.DragDropReorderMode
member.summary: Controls the ListBox's drag+drop behavior for reordering ListBoxItems. If true, items can be reordered by pushing on an item and dragging it to the position of another item. By default this is set to NoReorder.

member.name: E:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.ListBox.SelectionChanged
member.summary: Event raised whenever the selection changes. The object parameter is the sender (list box) and the SelectionChangedeventArgs contains information about the changed selected items.

member.name: E:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.ListBox.ControllerButtonPushed
member.summary: Event raised when the user presses a button, whether at the top level or internally on an item.
member.remarks: Until July 2024 this was only firing at the top level. July 2024 version also raises this event when a button is pushed on an item.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.ListBox.ScrollIntoView(System.Object,FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.ScrollIntoViewStyle)
member.summary: Scrolls the list view so that the argument item is in view. The amount of scrolling depends on the scrollIntoViewStyle argument.
member.param: The item to scroll into view.
The desired location of the item after scrolling.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.ListBox.ShowPopupListBox(FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.ScrollViewer,Gum.Wireframe.GraphicalUiElement,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Shows the argument popup using the argument listBoxParent to determine its destination layer.
member.param: The popup to show, for example a dropdown from a ComboBox or MenuItem
The parent visual, which would be something like the ComboBox.Visual

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.ListBox.AdditionalOffsetToCheckForDPadNavigation
member.summary: The additional offset to check when attempting to find a control when performing DPad navigation. This value is added to the InnerPanel's StackSpacing. Increasing this value is useful if objects in the ListBox are not of uniform size, but if the value is too large then navigation may skip rows or columns.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.ListBox.OnLoseFocus
member.summary: Removes focus from the ListBox, both at the top level and at the individual item level, even if CanListItemsLoseFocus is set to false.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.MenuItem.IsRecursiveMenuItem(Gum.Wireframe.GraphicalUiElement)
member.summary: Returns whether the argument itemVisual is the visual for either this MenuItem, or any MenuItem contained as a sub-item.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.PasswordBox.HandleCharEntered(System.Char)
member.summary: Will update the Text based on what was pressed, if existing text was already selected, or enter pressed. Also updates the caret position. See TextBox.cs for more details
member.param: The ascii code character that we need to perform an action on

member.name: T:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.Panel
member.summary: Base control which can contain multiple children. This is most commonly used when instantiating a StackPanel.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.Panel.Children
member.summary: Returns a read-only list of the children FrameworkElements of this panel.
member.remarks: This list is updated whenever the underlying Visual's Children change. This only contains FrameworkElements, so if a non-FrameworkElement Visual is added to this panel, it will not appear in this list.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.Panel.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new Panel using default visuals.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.Panel.#ctor(Gum.Wireframe.GraphicalUiElement)
member.summary: Creates a new Panel using the specified visual.
member.param: The visual to use.

member.name: F:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.ScrollBarVisibility.Auto
member.summary: The ScrollBar displays only if needed based on the size of the inner panel

member.name: F:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.ScrollBarVisibility.Hidden
member.summary: The ScrollBar remains invisible even if the contents of the inner panel exceed the size of its container

member.name: F:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.ScrollBarVisibility.Visible
member.summary: The ScrollBar always displays

member.name: T:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.ScrollViewer
member.summary: A control for displaying stacked items with a scroll bar. Items can be FrameworkElements (Forms) or regular visuals (GraphicalUiElements).

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.ScrollViewer.VerticalScrollBarValue
member.summary: The vertical scroll bar value. Assigning this automatically scrolls the ScrollViewer to the desired location. Percentage-based scrolling can be perofrmed by using VerticalScrollBarMaximum.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.ScrollViewer.VerticalScrollBarMaximum
member.summary: Gets the maximum amount the scroll bar can be scrolled to. This value is automatically assigned by the ScrollViewer in response to children being added.

member.name: T:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.Slider
member.summary: A control enabling changing a value between the specified Minimum and Maximum

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.Slider.TicksFrequency
member.summary: The frequency to snap the Slider value when IsSnapToTickEnabled is true. If IsSnapToTickEnabled is false, then this value is ignored.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.Slider.IsSnapToTickEnabled
member.summary: Controls whether the TickFrequency is applied when the slider is moved throuh the UI. If false, then any value between Minimum and Maximum is possible. If true, then values snap to the TickFrequency.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.TextBox.Text
member.summary: Gets and sets the displayed Text. If the text exceeds MaxLength, it will be truncated.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.TextBox.MaxLettersToShow
member.summary: The maximum letters to display. This can be used to create an effect where the text prints out letter-by-letter.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.TextBox.MaxNumberOfLines
member.summary: The maximum number of lines to display. This can be used to limit how many lines of text are displayed at one time.

member.name: E:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.TextBox.TextChanged
member.summary: Event raised when the Text property changes.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.TextBox.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new TextBox instance using the default visual.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.TextBox.#ctor(Gum.Wireframe.GraphicalUiElement)
member.summary: Creates a new TextBox instance using the specified visual.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.TextBox.HandleCharEntered(System.Char)
member.summary: Will update the Text based on what was pressed, if existing text was already selected, or enter pressed. Also updates the caret position. Does not handle control keys like(LEFT, RIGHT, UP, DOWN, HOME, END, BACKSPACE, DELETE, CTRL+C, CTRL+X, CTRL+V, CTRL+A) control key situations are handled by TextBoxBase.HandleKeyDown Key information is gathered from Keyboard.cs in the Activity method, then passed during TextBoxBase.DoKeyboardAction
member.param: The ascii code character that we need to perform an action on

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.TextBox.HandleBackspace(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Performs logic to handle backspace. This includes deleting individual letters, deleting selection, or deleting the previous word if ctrl is down.
member.param: Whether the ctrl key is held. If true, the entire word is deleted rather than a single character.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.TextBox.DeleteSelection
member.summary: Deletes the selected text, updates the caret position, and sets the SelectionLength to 0.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.TextBox.SelectAll
member.summary: Sets the SelectionStart to 0 and the SelectionLength to the length of the text, if any.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.TextCompositionEventArgs.Text
member.summary: The new text value.

member.name: F:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.TextBoxBase.indexPushed
member.summary: The cursor index where the cursor was last pushed, used for drag+select

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.TextBoxBase.IsCaretVisibleWhenNotFocused
member.summary: Whether the caret is visible when not focused. If true, the caret will always stay visible even if the TextBox has lost focus.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.TextBoxBase.AcceptsTab
member.summary: Whether pressing the tab key inserts a tab character. If true, then tab characters can be inserted.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.TextBoxBase.HandleKeyDown(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Input.Keys,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Handles special situations only like [LEFT, HOME, END, BACK (Backspace), RIGHT, UP, DOWN, DELETE, CTRL+C, CTRL+X, CTRL+V, CTRL+A] Data comes from the MonogameGum.Input.Keyboard.Activity() method earlier in the call stack, which gets the data from Monogame's Keyboard.GetState()

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.TextBoxBase.DoKeyboardAction(FlatRedBall.Input.IInputReceiverKeyboard)
member.summary: Performs key actions based on the keyboard input gathered during Keyboard.cs's Activity() method
member.param: State of keyboard from TextInput and Keyboard.GetKeys

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.TextBoxBase.GetLineNumber(System.Int32,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Returns the line number, start of the line, and relative index into the line given an absolute character index
member.param: The absolute character index, where 0 is the first character in the entire text box.
The line number containing the arugment character index.
The index of the first character in the argument lineNumber.
The relative index in the line, where 0 is the first character in the line.

member.name: P:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.TextBoxBase.AcceptsReturn
member.summary: Whether pressing the return key adds a newline to the text box. If false, the return key does not add a newline.
member.remarks: Setting this value to true makes the Visual use its LineModeCategoryState.Multi state.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.TextBoxBase.UpdateToSelection
member.summary: Updates the Selection visuals to match the current selection values.

member.name: F:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.TextBoxBase.edgeToTextPadding
member.summary: The maximum distance between the edge of the control and the text. Either we will want to make this customizable at some point, or remove this value and base it on some value of a parent, like we do for the scroll bar. This would require the Text to have a custom parent specifically defining the range of the text object.

member.name: E:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.ToggleButton.Checked
member.summary: Event raised when the IsChecked value is set to true. Seperate events exist for Indeterminate and Unchecked.
member.remarks: The Checked/Indeterminate/Unchecked event pattern follows wpf. For more info, see: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/5574613/separate-events-for-checked-and-unchecked-state-of-wpf-checkbox-why

member.name: E:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.ToggleButton.Indeterminate
member.summary: Event raised when the IsChecked value is set to null.

member.name: E:FlatRedBall.Forms.Controls.ToggleButton.Unchecked
member.summary: Event raised when the IsChecked value is set to false;

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Forms.Data.BinderHelpers.BuildGetter(System.Type,System.String)
member.summary: Null-safe getter: returns DependencyProperty.UnsetValue if any intermediate is null.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Forms.Data.BinderHelpers.BuildSetter(System.Type,System.String)
member.summary: Null-safe setter: no-op if any intermediate is null.

member.name: T:FlatRedBall.Forms.Data.PropertyPathObserver
member.summary: Watches a dotted-path (e.g. "Foo.Bar.Baz") on any INotifyPropertyChanged root and raises ValueChanged whenever the final value changes (or any segment in between changes).

member.name: E:FlatRedBall.Forms.Data.PropertyPathObserver.ValueChanged
member.summary: Raised whenever the value at the end of the path has changed.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Forms.Data.PropertyPathObserver.Attach(System.Object)
member.summary: Start observing on a new root object (detaches from the old).

member.name: T:FlatRedBall.Forms.MVVM.TypeMismatchBehavior
member.summary: Enum defining the possible behaviors when a ViewModel attempts to retrieve a value of a different type than the property stored.

member.name: F:FlatRedBall.Forms.MVVM.TypeMismatchBehavior.IgnoreError
member.summary: Error is ignored - the default value for the type is returned.

member.name: F:FlatRedBall.Forms.MVVM.TypeMismatchBehavior.ThrowException
member.summary: An InvalidCastException is thrown.

member.name: T:FlatRedBall.Forms.MVVM.ViewModel
member.summary: Standard implementation of an observable view model. This class implements the INotifyPropertyChanged interface so it is suitable for use as a base class for any ViewModel in an MVVM architecture. Typically this is used with Gum and FlatRedBall.Forms.

member.name: F:FlatRedBall.Forms.MVVM.ViewModel.DefaultTypeMismatchBehavior
member.summary: The behavior of the ViewModel when the Get function attempts to retrieve a value of a different type than the property stored. If set to Ignore, then no error is raised and the default for the type is returned. If this value is set to ThrowException, then an InvalidCastException is thrown.

member.name: M:FlatRedBall.Forms.MVVM.ViewModel.SetWithoutNotifying``1(``0,System.String,``0)
member.summary: Sets the underlying property without notifying any subscribers. This can be used for initial setting or in rare cases when properties should be set without any
member.typeparam: The type of the property being set.
member.param: The new value.
The name of the property to set - typically used with nameof.
The old value, used to determine if a value should be assigned. If the old value matches the new value, then the property is not assigned and the return value is false.
member.returns: Whether the value was set. This is true if the old property did not exist, or if the old value does not match the new value. If this is the initial set, then this value is ignored.

member.name: F:FlatRedBall.Forms.TextWrapping.NoWrap
member.summary: No line wrapping is performed.

member.name: F:FlatRedBall.Forms.TextWrapping.Wrap
member.summary: Line-breaking occurs if the line overflows beyond the available block width, even if the standard line breaking algorithm cannot determine any line break opportunity, as in the case of a very long word constrained in a fixed-width container with no scrolling allowed.
